remarks: A ring homomorphism preserves ` 1 ` .  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 24-Jun-2011.)
statement:
rnghom1.1 $e |- H = ( 2nd ` R ) $.
rnghom1.2 $e |- U = ( GId ` H ) $.
rnghom1.3 $e |- K = ( 2nd ` S ) $.
rnghom1.4 $e |- V = ( GId ` K ) $.
rngohom1 $p |- ( ( R e. RingOps /\ S e. RingOps /\ F e. ( R RngHom S ) ) -> ( F ` U ) = V ) $.
